title: Hyperdeterminantal Total Positivity
authors: Kenneth W. Johnson and Donald St. P. Richards
abstract:
For a given positive integer $m$, the concept of {\it hyperdeterminantal
total positivity} is defined for a kernel $K:\R^{2m} \to \R$, thereby
generalizing the classical concept of total positivity. Extending the
fundamental example, $K(x,y) = \exp(xy)$, $x, y \in \mathbb{R}$, of a classical
totally positive kernel, the hyperdeterminantal total positivity property of
the kernel $K(x_1,\ldots,x_{2m}) = \exp(x_1\cdots x_{2m})$, $x_1,\ldots,x_{2m}
\in \mathbb{R}$ is established. A hyperdeterminantal Binet-Cauchy argument is
applied to derive a generalization of Karlin's Basic Composition Formula, from
which several examples of hyperdeterminantal totally positive kernels are
constructed. Further generalizations of hyperdeterminantal total positivity by
means of the theory of finite reflection groups are described and some open
problems are posed.
